data.text:
After 4 month of traveling the absolut worst hotel I have ever been to.
Certainly not the cheapest but the most unkept. 
I am sure not being the first one with fleas in my room. Moskitos too.
If you get any service you will be promptly asked for tip. 
If you do not give enough you will get a chance to do better the next day. (!!)
Calling reception ends up with a recording, telling you: temporarily out of service.
My request for early check in was ignored 4 times by several different receptionist.
They just charged my credit card and let me wait for many hours.
At least I was waiting long enough to figure that more people had complaints.....
Just don't go there!
data.title: Fleas in my room. Not clean, no service. Ignorant management.

data.text:
This newly built to look old section o f Dubai has been finished in a superb fashion.  That goes for the Al Seef  Heritage Hotel 100%.  The rooms are spread over a number of buildings and our room was wonderful, with a view over the Dubai Creek.  The fixtures and fittings are just plain spot on!
The bed was comfortable, two sorts of pillows, the bathroom was great with a really good shower.  The room had a Nespresso machine which was useful as the coffee in the restaurant at breakfast was undrinkable.
The location has plenty of cafes and far too many shops selling spices, pashminas etc- BUT the spruikers outside the shops were actually nice and not overly percistent.
The breakfast was an accetable buffet with freshly made omlettes.  However,did I mention the coffee the coffee was diabolical?  ( Yes, I am from Melbourne and a coffee snob).
There was access to RTA ferries and all sorts of 'small' boat rides, a metro station about 30 minutes walk away too. 
I loved the hotel and complex.  Sure, it is a bit-Disneyland but honestly done so well that it feels really old.
data.title: Beautiful hotel in an easy location for a couple of nights' stay
